subject: Leadership
title: Nonverbal Communication
description: A fast breakdown of Nonverbal Communication for builders.

hook.text: A leader says she's excited about the new direction. Her arms are crossed and her tone is flat. Nobody believes her.

buildup.text: Research suggests 55% of communication is body language, 38% tone, and 7% words. What you say matters less than how.

discovery.text: Mehrabian's rule applies to emotional messages. When words and body conflict, people trust the body every single time.

twist.text: Leaders can't fake congruence. If you don't believe the message, your body will betray you. Authenticity is physical.

climax.text: Align words, tone, and gestures. Make eye contact, stand open, and modulate your voice. Consistency builds trust.

punchline.text: Your body speaks before your mouth opens.

quiz.question: What happens when a leader's words and body language conflict?
